entry.content:
Algorithmic Trading

Even though a significant volume of modern-day trading is algorithmic, this volume is not diverse; it is mainly due to a few firms. Most individual and/or small-scale investors still do not have the means to engage in algorithmic trading. Our technology can help mitigate this situation and make algorithmic trading more accessible to all interested investors.

In order to prove our technology, we are currently using it ourselves to engage in algorithmic trading in cryptocurrency exchanges. If successful, this operation will also generate our first revenue stream.

Industrial Internet of Things

The ubiquity of IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) edge devices has made the Industry 4.0 vision achievable, yet many small/mid-market businesses are not able to take advantage of this promising paradigm shift. We believe that this unfortunate situation is mainly due to the absence of a turnkey end-to-end system that these businesses can adopt with only a small amount of friction to their current day-to-day operations.

We hope to utilize our technology to enable small/mid-market businesses to take advantage of the Industry 4.0 paradigm.

entry.title: Our Company
entry.summary:
Mission and Vision

We believe that high-efficiency stream processing, when driven by robust AI techniques, can be a game changing advantage for many businesses. At Gordius Technologies, we strive to develop a complete end-to-end system for processing, analyzing, storing and acting on high-throughput time-series data.

Focus Areas

Our strategy is to introduce our technology into verticals where time-series data is the central "resource" or the "asset" of businesses. As a first step, we chose to focus on the algorithmic trading space. Our second focus area will be the IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) space.

entry.content:
Our technology is "cloud-native": Our software runs on AWS where we leverage Kubernetes to orchestrate our software components, which we develop in Python and containerize via Docker.

We use FoundationDB to store/house time-series data. FoundationDB's CP consistency model and its customizable layers enable us to effectively utilize it as a high-throughput time-series database.

We utilize both in-house ML (Machine Learning) code and also leverage PyTorch for our ML components.

entry.content:
Mehmet Ozan Kabak, Ph.D.Founder


Mehmet Ozan got two B.S. degrees from METU in 2008 (double majoring in Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering) and M.S./Ph.D. degrees in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University in 2010/2015 where he focused on applications of non-linear optimization techniques. Prior to founding Gordius Technologies, Mehmet Ozan worked in various start-ups in Silicon Valley: Upon graduation, he first joined Striim where he was responsible for adding ML capabilities to Striim's software. After Striim, he joined OptumSoft where he worked closely with the CEO to design, develop and launch OptumSoft's IIoT technology. Lastly, he was with Naver Labs where he worked on core software technologies for autonomous urban air vehicles and helped establish the new Silicon Valley branch.

In his free time, Mehmet Ozan enjoys sailing, playing tennis and spending time with his family.
